DataElement.preferredName: Ovarian Cancer and Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Regional Lymph Node N Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the ovarian and primary peritoneal carcinoma based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to clinical evaluated N stage of an ovarian tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the ovaries, the female reproductive glands in which the ova (eggs) are formed. The ovaries are located in the pelvis, one on each side of the uterus.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the ovaries, the female reproductive glands in which the ova (eggs) are formed. The ovaries are located in the pelvis, one on each side of the uterus.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC:American Joint Committee on Cancer Cancer Staging Manual, 6th Ed., 2002

ValueDomain.preferredName: Ovarian Cancer and Primary Peritoneal Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 N Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer or primary peritoneal carcinoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  Ovarian cancer and primary peritoneal carcinoma are surgically/pathologically staged malignancies. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Ovarian Cancer and Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma pN0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Ovarian cancer or primary peritoneal carcinoma without regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Ovarian cancer or primary peritoneal carcinoma with regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Ovarian cancer or primary peritoneal carcinoma in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
